definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Job 28:7 path, pathway (as raised);—abs. ´[[נ]] Job 18:10 + 3 t.; cstr. [[נְתִיב]] Ps 119:35; sf. 3 fs. [[נְתִיבָהַ]] Pr 12:28 (si vera l., v. infr.; on om. of Mappik v. Ges:§ 91 e, v. infr.) ;—path Job 18:10 (fig.) Job 28:7, Job 41:24 (track); Ps 78:50 (fig.); [[נְתִיב מִחְוֹתֶיְ]] Ps 119:35 the path of thy commands; [[דֶּרֶח נְתִיבָה אַל־מָוֶת]] Pr 12:28 the journey of her pathway is no-death! ‖[[בְּאׂרַח חְדָקָה חַיִּים]] Ew Be De. v. [[אַל]] p. 39 a supr.; others rd. [[אֶל־]], and either transl. ´[[נ]] by-paths (Hi Str), or substitute a syn. of ‘wickedness’ (cf. Now Frankenb; Perles:Analekten 87 f. [[נִתְעָבִים]] after Levy:Ch WB i. 28 b).
